SEARCH
Package com.etiennecollin.tp1

Class Guild

java.lang.Object
com.etiennecollin.tp1.Guild
public class Guild extends Object
The Guild class represents a guild of heroes. The guild contains a list of heroes for each of the 5 hero categories (0 to 4). The guild also has a bank containing cash and armor resources.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Guild(double initialCashBalance, int initialArmorBalance)
    The Guild constructor creates a new guild and initializes it with a bank.

  • Constructor Details

    • Guild

      public Guild(double initialCashBalance, int initialArmorBalance)
      The Guild constructor creates a new guild and initializes it with a bank.
      Parameters:
      initialCashBalance - A double representing the initial cash balance of the guild's bank.
      initialArmorBalance - An integer representing the initial armor balance of the guild's bank.

  • Method Details

    • buyHero

      public void buyHero(String name, int category, double costInCash, int costInArmor, double maxHealth) throws Exception
      The buyHero method adds a new hero to the guild if it doesn't already exist in the guild and if the guild can afford it.
      Parameters:
      name - A String representing the name of the new hero.
      category - An integer representing the category of the new hero.
      costInCash - A double representing the cost in cash of the new hero.
      costInArmor - An integer representing the cost in armor of the new hero.
      maxHealth - A double representing the maximum health of the new hero.
      Throws:
      Exception - If the hero already exists in the guild, if the hero category is invalid, or if the guild can't afford the hero.

    • buyArmor

      public void buyArmor(int numOfArmors, int costPerArmor) throws Exception
      Allows the guild to purchase armor with its cash balance.
      Parameters:
      numOfArmors - The number of armors to purchase.
      costPerArmor - The cost per armor in cash.
      Throws:
      Exception - If the guild does not have enough cash to afford the armor.

    • doQuest

      public void doQuest(int questCategory, double healthCost, int cashReward, int armorReward) throws Exception
      Allows a hero from the guild to complete a quest with the specified category, health cost, and rewards.
      Parameters:
      questCategory - The category of hero required to complete the quest.
      healthCost - The amount of health the hero must spend to complete the quest.
      cashReward - The amount of cash reward for completing the quest.
      armorReward - The amount of armor reward for completing the quest.
      Throws:
      Exception - If no hero is available to complete the quest or if the hero dies during the quest.

    • trainHero

      public void trainHero(String name) throws Exception
      Trains the hero with the specified name, increasing their category and health, and decreasing the guild's cash and armor balances.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the hero to train.
      Throws:
      Exception - If the hero is not part of the guild, or if the hero is already at the maximum category level, or if the guild does not have enough resources to afford the training.

    • getHeroCategories

      public LinkedList<Hero>[] getHeroCategories()
      Returns the hero categories of the current guild.
      Returns:
      The hero categories of the current guild.

    • getBank

      public Bank getBank()
      Returns the bank object of the current guild.
      Returns:
      The bank object of the current guild.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of the guild, including its categories of heroes, and its bank.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      A string representation of the guild.
